blog.name: ao3feed-theforceawakens
blog.title: AO3Feed-The Force Awakens
blog.description: Fan fiction for Star Wars: The Force Awakens

title: Tea Time
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2zD39ig

by dulcedelecherous

Hux devises a game to test Kylo’s obedience. Kylo worries it’s a rigged game and the odds are against him.

Words: 1266, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Kylo Ren, Armitage Hux
  • Relationships: Armitage Hux/Kylo Ren, Armitage Hux/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren
  • Additional Tags: Light Dom/sub, Riding Crops, Wrists, misuse of biscuits, Leather Kink, Glove Kink, How can you not with these two?, Frottage, Oral Sex, surprisingly soft, Obedience, Praise Kink, Short & Sweet, Plot What Plot/Porn Without Plot


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2zD39ig

blog.name: imfluentinfangirlandgay
blog.title: My name is trash
blog.description: Like my selfie? Just me and my friends

summary: Getting up at 7 for Spanish is like getting out of the shower and leaving the warm bathroom just to be sat down to watch a movie...
body: Getting up at 7 for Spanish is like getting out of the shower and leaving the warm bathroom just to be sat down to watch a movie but the movie is just an hour and a half of pictures of rocks with 7 seconds of the Imperial March on repeat the whole time and then for the quiz after the movie it asks for a plot summary of the Land Before Time

An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Feelings
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xJiCMj

by Emilill

One night, when Qui-Gon is already asleep, Obi-Wan Kenobi and Duchess Satine Kryze have a very honest conversation about each other and their feelings. But are things really what they seem?

Words: 1142, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008) - All Media Types, Star Wars Prequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Satine Kryze, Qui-Gon Jinn
  • Relationships: Obi-Wan Kenobi/Satine Kryze
  • Additional Tags: Love, Love Confessions, Talking, Honesty, Awkward Flirting, Awkward Conversations, First Kiss, Memories, Repressed Memories


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xJiCMj

blog.name: dotsandfoxes
blog.title: Dots and Foxes
blog.description: science fiction + feminism + creative utopias (h_vane on AO3)

tags: foxes gets weirdly personal and chatty about the last two years as refracted through the lens of fic
(I'm having a really hard time with the Supreme Court hearings)
I don't know that these are particularly HELPFUL descriptions but even if you ignore my rambling go follow the links
because these stories are all REALLY GOOD
title: weirdly specific fic recs: part 1
body:
a long time ago, @sethnakht and I were talking about fic, and it made me think of doing a small series of really specific fic recs. and then @akathecentimetre mentioned she was looking for fic or art or other creative things, and that seemed like a good reason to get my act together on some weirdly chatty, deeply personal Star Wars fic recs. 

to get some things out of the way: I am terrible at summaries. I describe movies with a mix of flailing and bullet points of plot no one else cares about. (Imagine Stefon describing New York’s Hottest Club, except it’s me, failing to sell you on Sense and Sensibility.) Also, I read freakishly fast, and I recommend a lot of lengthy slow-burn fics like it’s nothing, so take my casual references to “reading in one setting” with a bantha-sized grain of salt. 

three fics for: sinking into like a comfortable couch when you’re burned-out, tired, overworked, and/or lonely in The Hague in August 2016.  

1. Beekeeping and Husbandry, by Meggory. Obi-Wan/Qui-Gon; Qui-Gon Lives AU; complete, 135,315 words. 

Qui-Gon lives, gets some therapy, reworks his life, falls in love, defeats the Sith. 

This is: one of the fics that sold me on Qui-Gon/Obi-Wan as a pairing; an extremely loving portrait of the work that goes into realizing you’re not being the person you want to be and changing that; an ode to the power of working on your shit ™; a sweet and warm take on Mace Windu Unfucks the Timeline, which I am always here for. It has a thoughtful and caring Dooku, which I am also (somewhat surprisingly) here for. It has a very attractive Obi-Wan with a man-bun and a piratical aspect. (I am consistently here for these things.) 

Beekeeping and Husbandry is wonderful because it sets up emotional growth for its characters and then delivers, wonderfully. It’s a slow burn, but every step feels earned, and the payoff, both in little moments of character development and in the resolution of the overall plot, is so very good. This is the fic I read in bed on a Saturday morning after a week of writing in the library for 10 hours/day because I had to finish my dissertation, and knowing that I had to get up and apply for more (hopeless) academic jobs all weekend. This fic and I have been in the trenches together. It holds up very well. 

Beekeeping and Husbandry also has a short sequel, and if you like what Meggory did with the pairing, you will probably also like Constellations Reveal Themselves One Star at a Time and Hearts and Flimsi. I’m currently in love with Meggory’s Rebel Hearts, a post-Order 66 Qui-Gon/Obi-Wan fic that’s in the process of updating each week. Go read it now. 

2. to treat everything as if it were a nail, by thingswithteeth. Jyn/Cassian (eventually); Jyn & Bodhi & Cassian & Baze & Chirrut & Galen; Rogue One AU; complete, 102,751 words. 

Jyn grows up on Eadu; there are many different ways to rebel. 

It was a rough year, so I genuinely can’t remember when I read this. (Probably some time spring 2017? I found it in the evening, not too late at night, but late enough that I definitely stayed up too late to finish it.) This is a fic about smart people genuinely trying to solve problems, in the slow-burniest of slow burns possible. It’s about commitment, and incremental change, and how sometimes your resistance lies in just surviving long enough to get into position to do one small thing that lights up the path for other people. (I know, this is basically the theme of Rogue One, but this version has a lot less child abandonment and death.) It’s about resistance and hope and wearing down evil and using the gifts and opportunities you have to make your best possible contribution. I should re-read this tonight instead of going back on Twitter now that the US news cycle has woken up again. 

It’s a Rogue One AU where not everyone dies, but not everyone lives either. If this is something you’re cautious about reading, the author is great about tagging the chapters. 

3. a city built on water and peace in our time, by Deputychairman. Poe/Finn, diplomacy and bureaucracy will save the galaxy, Brexit coping fic; complete, 13,668 and 15,621 words, respectively. 

Yes, this is Brexit coping fic. Or collapse of post-WWII European integration and liberal internationalism coping fic. I needed this fic, for reasons both geopolitical and personal, and I’ve come back to it again and again ever since. I read these for the first time while walking around The Hague, alone, in late summer 2016 at the end of a very long five city research trip, feeling very, very insignificant and very uncertain, and that was why I needed Finn rebuilding his life after Starkiller and finding purpose and strength in intergalactic diplomacy and bureaucratic peace processes. (I’m very drawn to slow, inglorious, but utterly necessary work, it turns out – the work of keeping the lights on, the work of very, very slowly making the universe a better place.) And then to throw in Poe, who has also been tossed around by the war but even more by its fallout, and who has to cope with the ways in which the personal is political and vice versa. (Lest I undersell it, the smut is also great.) 

I can’t get away from the fact that these fics were getting me through the endless destabilizing political chaos of the past two years. The fact that they’re all about resilience and matter-of-fact, unglamorous, steady hope in the face of terrifying threats seems…relevant. But they also have that core of emotional honesty and warmth that you need when you’re worn out, too tired, and you know you need to keep going. This presidency will end; the moral arc of the universe will someday bend towards justice; I will, someday, get a permanent job, and enough sleep to make up for the last two years. And in the meantime, the fic will get us through.

Qui-Gon lives, gets some therapy, reworks his life, falls in love, defeats the Sith. 

This is: one of the fics that sold me on Qui-Gon/Obi-Wan as a pairing; an extremely loving portrait of the work that goes into realizing you’re not being the person you want to be and changing that; an ode to the power of working on your shit ™; a sweet and warm take on Mace Windu Unfucks the Timeline, which I am always here for. It has a thoughtful and caring Dooku, which I am also (somewhat surprisingly) here for. It has a very attractive Obi-Wan with a man-bun and a piratical aspect. (I am consistently here for these things.) 

Beekeeping and Husbandry is wonderful because it sets up emotional growth for its characters and then delivers, wonderfully. It’s a slow burn, but every step feels earned, and the payoff, both in little moments of character development and in the resolution of the overall plot, is so very good. This is the fic I read in bed on a Saturday morning after a week of writing in the library for 10 hours/day because I had to finish my dissertation, and knowing that I had to get up and apply for more (hopeless) academic jobs all weekend. This fic and I have been in the trenches together. It holds up very well. 

Beekeeping and Husbandry also has a short sequel, and if you like what Meggory did with the pairing, you will probably also like Constellations Reveal Themselves One Star at a Time and Hearts and Flimsi. I’m currently in love with Meggory’s Rebel Hearts, a post-Order 66 Qui-Gon/Obi-Wan fic that’s in the process of updating each week. Go read it now. 

2. to treat everything as if it were a nail, by thingswithteeth. Jyn/Cassian (eventually); Jyn & Bodhi & Cassian & Baze & Chirrut & Galen; Rogue One AU; complete, 102,751 words. 

Jyn grows up on Eadu; there are many different ways to rebel. 

It was a rough year, so I genuinely can’t remember when I read this. (Probably some time spring 2017? I found it in the evening, not too late at night, but late enough that I definitely stayed up too late to finish it.) This is a fic about smart people genuinely trying to solve problems, in the slow-burniest of slow burns possible. It’s about commitment, and incremental change, and how sometimes your resistance lies in just surviving long enough to get into position to do one small thing that lights up the path for other people. (I know, this is basically the theme of Rogue One, but this version has a lot less child abandonment and death.) It’s about resistance and hope and wearing down evil and using the gifts and opportunities you have to make your best possible contribution. I should re-read this tonight instead of going back on Twitter now that the US news cycle has woken up again. 

It’s a Rogue One AU where not everyone dies, but not everyone lives either. If this is something you’re cautious about reading, the author is great about tagging the chapters. 

3. a city built on water and peace in our time, by Deputychairman. Poe/Finn, diplomacy and bureaucracy will save the galaxy, Brexit coping fic; complete, 13,668 and 15,621 words, respectively. 

Yes, this is Brexit coping fic. Or collapse of post-WWII European integration and liberal internationalism coping fic. I needed this fic, for reasons both geopolitical and personal, and I’ve come back to it again and again ever since. I read these for the first time while walking around The Hague, alone, in late summer 2016 at the end of a very long five city research trip, feeling very, very insignificant and very uncertain, and that was why I needed Finn rebuilding his life after Starkiller and finding purpose and strength in intergalactic diplomacy and bureaucratic peace processes. (I’m very drawn to slow, inglorious, but utterly necessary work, it turns out – the work of keeping the lights on, the work of very, very slowly making the universe a better place.) And then to throw in Poe, who has also been tossed around by the war but even more by its fallout, and who has to cope with the ways in which the personal is political and vice versa. (Lest I undersell it, the smut is also great.) 

I can’t get away from the fact that these fics were getting me through the endless destabilizing political chaos of the past two years. The fact that they’re all about resilience and matter-of-fact, unglamorous, steady hope in the face of terrifying threats seems…relevant. But they also have that core of emotional honesty and warmth that you need when you’re worn out, too tired, and you know you need to keep going. This presidency will end; the moral arc of the universe will someday bend towards justice; I will, someday, get a permanent job, and enough sleep to make up for the last two years. And in the meantime, the fic will get us through.
trail.content_abstract:
a long time ago, @sethnakht and I were talking about fic, and it made me think of doing a small series of really specific fic recs. and then @akathecentimetre mentioned she was looking for fic or art or other creative things, and that seemed like a good reason to get my act together on some weirdly chatty, deeply personal Star Wars fic recs. 

to get some things out of the way: I am terrible at summaries. I describe movies with a mix of flailing and bullet points of plot no one else cares about. (Imagine Stefon describing New York’s Hottest Club, except it’s me, failing to sell you on Sense and Sensibility.) Also, I read freakishly fast, and I recommend a lot of lengthy slow-burn fics like it’s nothing, so take my casual references to “reading in one setting” with a bantha-sized grain of salt. 

three fics for: sinking into like a comfortable couch when you’re burned-out, tired, overworked, and/or lonely in The Hague in August 2016.

summary: Some time ago I saw a couple of gifs of Adam Driver as Paul Sevier in Midnight Special and someone reposted “Imagine Kylo Ren...
body:
Some time ago I saw a couple of gifs of Adam Driver as Paul Sevier in Midnight Special and someone reposted “Imagine Kylo Ren coming into the interrogatory room with Rey like that”. I had to draw it. It’s been a while and I can’t find the post so if anyone know who said that please tell me to give credit.

Now into the panels, Forgive my crappy coloring and non existent backgrounds.

summary: Among the countless hours inside a hospital
title: Among the countless hours inside a hospital
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DDPFXG

by Nimirie

¿Qué pasaría si se tiene un prompt y se escribe sobre él, pero en diferentes fandoms?

Relación médico / estudiante, en un hospital.

Así que aquí tienen el resultado: Kylux, Hannigran, Johnlock, Thorki, 00Q y… OK, soy muy nueva en el fandom de Mo Dao Zu Shi pero también hay un fic de Wei Wu Xian y Lan Wang Ji aunque no sepa si su ship tiene nombre.

Espero sea de su agrado.

Words: 4743, Chapters: 2/6, Language: Español

Series: Part 1 of Among countless hours inside a hospital

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy, Hannibal (TV), James Bond (Craig movies), Sherlock (TV), The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Mo Dao Zu Shi
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Characters: Armitage Hux, Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Will Graham, Hannibal Lecter, James Bond, Q (James Bond), Sherlock Holmes, John Watson, Loki (Marvel), Thor (Marvel), Wei Wuxian, Lan Wang Ji
  • Relationships: Armitage Hux/Kylo Ren, Will Graham/Hannibal Lecter, James Bond/Q, Sherlock Holmes/John Watson, Loki/Thor (Marvel), Wei Wuxian/Lan Wangji
